name: Assault Android Cactus
description: Assault Android Cactus is an intense arcade style twin stick shooter - pick from one of nine unique synthetic heroines and blast your way through overwhelming robots hordes to save the ship from its own workforce. Supports single player and local co-op game modes.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Core 2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD 4000 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Core i5 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTX 460 or AMD Radeon HD6850 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: If this game had online co op then I'd play nothing else but this.
Absolutely one of the best twin stick shooters around. Tremendous work and oh so wonderfully Dreamcast-y.

Damn if i had known about this game before the Humble Bundle i'd have paid full price, it's so much fun! Tight controls, good soundtrack, characters and to top it all off it's pretty funny. The voice acting is on point as well.  Hope we get to see more from this studio.

Very addicting and exhilarating out of the box, even when played alone. Crazy good in 3d with patch on helixmod blog. Also, lots of playable characters and unlockables. Control feels tight and game can get quite challenging. Great OST. Highly recommended.

Assault Android Cactus is an arcade style twin stick shooter set in a vivid sci-fi universe. I recommend playing it solo for hunting those highscores, but full 4 player couch-coop is lots of fun too!  So what has this game to offer? Let me tell you!  - Awesome Bosses (with bullet-hell-ish attack patterns) - 25 Levels with a few cutscenes - Infinity Drive (Survival Mode) - Daily Drive (a randomized daily level with changing enemies and bosses) - 3 color-coded powerups that you don't want to miss! - 9 different playable androids, each with their own unique primary and secondary attacks - Cute but solid visuals that fit the genre really well - 4 player local co-op - Great Soundtrack (I mean it!) - Unlimited framerate!  Please give this game some love! It was in early access for over 3 years and has received a ton of polish. Its current post-release state is fantastic and I couldn’t find any bugs.  For those not looking for repeat plays to compete for score, the price might be too high and you could wait for a sale. That said I still feel it’s absolutely worth the money and I’d recommend it to anyone who has any interest in twin stick shooters!
Got this for free from EB Games, who else did? Very fun, reminds me of Dead Ops arcade from COD but better. Good graphics.

Assault Android Cactus is a fantastic Twin Stick Shooter with tons of variety in the characters, playstyles, stage designs and extra unlockables (such as Concept Art and Codex's, to game changing gameplay options).  Featuring a 25 stage long campaign featuring unique stages and bosses, Daily Challenges to compare to the rest of the world, an Infinity Mode to test how long you can last against the endless hordes and a Boss Rush mode which is exactly what it sounds like.  You can select between 9 different characters (4 from start, the rest though the course of the campaign), all with their own different personalities as well as weapons and playstyles that vary your playstyle greatly.  Easy to learn, hard to master at it's finest in twin stick shooty games.

It runs very smoothly, and the art design is great. After I beat the main story, I replayed it for the daily challenges, achievements, and the 'endless' game mode. I will probably pick it up again sometime in the future, so I can finish off the challenges. If you're a perfectionist that loves twin stick shooters, then this is your game. It's one of the few games I bought recently without regretting my decision.

Fast, colorful, intensely action packed, smoothly controlled mayhem. That pretty much sums it up. Witch Beam always seemed to know exactly where they wanted to go with this, and they nailed it like 95% perfect. If you like arcadey twin stick shooters, I see absolutely no reason to not pick this up.  It's highly competent at what it does. Read the steam description, watch the trailers, and if you like what you see, I'm sure you'll have a blast and get your money's worth. Hell, there's even a demo. Go try it!

One of the best in both score attack and twin-stick shmup categories. This is 100% fair hundreds of hours of self-improvement with very diverse levels, a decent amount of characters, deep gameplay combined with a simplistic control scheme, 4 player CO-OP mode and enemy combinations varying from difficult to evil. If you're thinking about buying this on a console, you might wanna stick to PC after all. Why is that? PC has the cheapest controllers\input devices and believe me - you WILL throw those around screaming. Also, the game is fairly discourageing at the beggining, but you shouldn't judge it too quickly. It isn't as hard as it seems. Last subject of importance - the score attack nature of the game. I don't like score attack games most of the time, this one is different. It's not a score attack game, it's a shmup with a score-attack system in it, which makes it more fun to keep playing for a long time. I doubt you'll be getting 200 hours of gameplay for 13 bucks elswhere. Aspecially 200 hours you enjoy and feel satisfied after.

Pristine mechanics. Everything fits together and is balanced to perfection. Bold, charming aesthetic. Radical soundtrack. Assault Android Cactus is a masterfully crafted game, a prime example of symmetry between development workflows. I can't say this about many games.   An experience well worth having, and as a developer, a game that inspires me to make better games.
Such a good game, reminds me of playing ratchet and clank deadlocked like 10 years ago.

This is the first shooter in ages that has me glued to my seat. The character designs are briliant and the shooting is fun and fast paced. It is never an overwhelming shooter, that is until you start high score chasing and playing the 'drive' modes. This game wants you to play through to the end on campaign mode. Each character has their strengths and weaknesses and finding out each for each character will be very fun. The only thing I could hope for in this game is for a better or more detailed bio for the character Starch. All the bosses seem terrified of her and I really want to know what this incident is that mandated her shut down and lock up. It just has to be a great story. Plus her dialogue is hilarious. Is it obvious that she is my favorite character? If this game runs so well on my gaming PC i can just imagine how well it will run on my PS4 when released. I cannot wait, this will be one of a very few games I will purchase twice. Before I forget let me mention the soundtrack. It is pretty good as well. It lends perfectly to the very fst nature of the game. Some levels will have better tracks than others but nowhere in the soundtrack would you say it is underwhelming. If you don't like shooters I think this one will change your mind. If you think you have played the best shooter try this one to let it try to change your mind. This is one game on Steam (and soon on consoles) that has earned it's brilliant reputation.
Fantastic Australian-made Indie Score Attack Shmup!

I don't usually write reviews but when a game gets me feeling strongly enough be it bad or good i cant help it. In this case, i cant get enough.   Now, i SUCK at bullet-hells and usually cant get anywhere and thusly hate playing them save a few acceptions. this is one of those.   IN SHORT: BUY THIS  though a longer look here's more:  dont get me wrong that does not mean this is not challenging... getting that S+ rank... yeah... calling that easy would be a lie to say the very least.   I originally bought this game a LONG time ago back after seeing Nerd3 play it. i just had to have it and it was even fun way back then but after a long blank of not being able to update due to internet i finally came back to it and im in love. There are VERY few games that i love enough to feel motivated to go full completionist on.... BUT I GOTTA GET THOSE S+ RANKS ;n;  The Characters are pretty good and diverse and there are times and a few lines that are pretty funny too. that opening cutscene was pretty swell. each character has their own playstyle to it due to how their weapons work thusly meaning a character swap will change how you play. Aubergine for example is pretty good as you can take cover while still shooting due to how her weapon works and i found Shiitake and Starch were better for bosess as they had weapons that fit single target damage. Coral is an ideal crowdsweeper but is a risky play as you have to get close.... and so on.  i know i've said 'i dont usually' alot here but its true, this game got me notcing things that take alot to get me to notice. thusly i transition onto music. its rare i notice ingame music but when i do i love it. this one, well, the main menu theme is catchy enough as it is. never seen a death screen with lyrics and at first i was kinda put off by it but honestly after it grew on me i kinda get tempted to stay dead and listen now.  I will DEFINATLEY by the OST for this when i get the money and that makes a first for me. i've got a few one off tracks i listen to sometimes from games i like such as fleets arrive from mass effect and a fair few choice tracks from Legend of dragoon but this? well i like it enough to buy it without hesetation.  The extras are pretty fun too. being able to set A.I coop players on is a fun idea and i like the additional options you can unlock to make things even harder for yourself. still yet to try them all. First person mode in a bullet-hell is something im looking forward to..... in a kinda Masohcistic way...  it runs pretty well on my computer and even on my crappy really old worn down useless laptop for that matter before it hit the point it cant run ANYTHING and thats saying something. back when this ran on my laptop you'd have better chances getting a flash game to work on a calculator in most cases.   the graphics and artstyle are nice and while not superhyperrealiticultraperfect levels most people dream for they dont need to be as the graphics look good as they feel styled. i feel it will likley age well because of that. i've played plenty of old games that still look good today because they took a style to their graphics and went with it instead of trying to look realistic. this is a game i feel will be able to pull that off.   as many people have said before the one thing that would make this game one of the best things ever is easily an online multiplayer. co-op modes for this game would do it a world of good and the level where the boss has android health even implies you could have some rather fun competative modes too. however even without those this game holds up on its own but that would of been the icing on the cake for me and im sure plenty of other people would agree. Im not sure what the Devs of this game have planned but i'd like to maby see more of this game and maybe some DLC or expansions. the story and ending works well to say you could easily have more stories and levels and so on and i'd love to see more and learn more about this world and the characters in the game.  Overall i HIGHLY reccomend this game. it is well worth a look even if you aren't so much a fan of the type of game it is. i usually dont go for twinsticks or bullet-hells and i love this gamenevertheless.  It was good back in its early stages and it has easily improved alot since then to even greater levels.   Now thats enough typing.... i have some S+ ranks to go get...

Oh goodness. This little bundle of chaos was a treat for the eyes, ears and the thirst for mayhem. If you push through, you may finish the game in a few hours. However, there is a wide variety of playable characters, each with their own colourful personality and playstyle that might tempt you to give things another go, if not face the bosses over and over just to see the differing exchanges of dialgoue.   There's lot of polish and charm in what is a fairly solid game.  The game is local multiplayer too, so if you have a mate or three, don't miss the chance to have a blast.

Assault Android Cactus is an action / arcade game very entertaining, offering many extras and as many as 9 playable characters, each has different skills! The game is very good, both as regards the gameplay very dynamic and fun that as regards the features unlockable, that are really many! In addition there is the possibility to play up to 4 players in co-op locally. In short, Android Assault Cactus is a game cheap and offers a lot! I would absolutely recommend!         YouTube™ Video:  Assault Android Cactus | PC Gameplay (Steam)
Won this in a giveaway from TheSpartanShow and 10 minutes in and I know I'm going to be addicted. A lot of fun.
A short, but fairly tough game. It is definitely worth the money.
this is so much fun....i better shut up
When I don't want to think about much, and want to blow things up, I keep coming back to this lately.

Disclosure: Review copy received from the developer.  I can't realy think of any flaws for Assault Android Cactus. The game is stellar. The only people I wouldn't recommend the game to are people who actively hate twin-stick shooters, and even then I would suggest trying the demo to be sure because I'm not normally a huge fan of this genre myself. (I'm terrible at dodging bullets.) Everything about the game just goes together so well and creates a great experience.  My full review is on     IndieGames.com .  [indiegames.com]

One of the best dual-stick shooters in recent memory. Renegade Ops is the last game in this genre that I can recall being this fun and polished, and that was four long years ago.  Sound design is great. A lot of graphical polish and some very cool enemy designs. I don't really like the look of the playable characters, but my dislike of them hasn't been detrimental to my overall enjoyment of the game. It might just be me, but I get a creepy doll vibe from them.  I do wish the campaign were a tad bit longer, but there is a ton of replayability to it along with some additional modes.

An extremely well-polished twinstick shooter.  Featuring an all-female android cast with gorgeous sound and visuals, AAC really is just superb. I'm not a huge bullet hell or schmup player, but this game has a great difficulty curve and the battery mechanic does set it apart from other titles. The battery serves as the fail condition when it is empty and it forces the player to stay on their toes and keep engaging in the action.  Playing it in coop is fun as you see the ballet of bullets stream across the screen.  Also Holly.

I was pleasantly surprised by Assault Android Cactus. I usually am not a huge fan of the twin stick shooter genre because frankly I am usually not very good at them. The main reason I am terrible at these games is that I have a hard time avoiding enemies when there is a bunch of things happening on the screen at one time.  Therefore I really liked the idea behind the battery power. In Assault Android Cactus you don't die when your lose all of your health. Instead you are stunned. You need to make sure that your android doesn't run out of battery power though. In order to recharge your batteries you need to kill enough enemies in order to have one drop a battery powerup. I liked that Assault Android Cactus allowed you to focus on killing enemies instead of spending all your time trying to avoid enemy projectiles.   The only major issues I had with the game was the length and difficulty. The main storyline only takes four to five hours to complete. Outside of the bosses the game is quite easy and you will rarely die.   If you hate twin stick shooters you won't like Assault Android Cactus. If you have even a passing interest in the genre I would recommend picking up the game at some point either at full retail or during a sale.  Note: I received a free review copy of the game from the developer.    Read My Full Review   [www.geekyhobbies.com]
Really fun. Fast pace, solid mechanics and a good amount of depth and variety.

Assault Android Cactus was one of my early purchases since joining Steam a couple of years ago, and even in its Early Access stage, had remained one of my favorite games from my library. Now that it's finally complete, I would love for anyone who's been on the fence to give this wonderful arcade blast-a-thon a go.  What makes AAC such a great videogame is that it is just that -- a damn videogame. There's no need here for bloaty features like RPG elements, perks, weapon customization, or what have you. If you just wanna turn off your brain an' go out gunz a-blazin' with unlimited ammo, this game is it, and the three-person Witch Beam crew were steadfast in delivering that experience. With little to get in your way, AAC is perfect pick-up-and-play fun for both casual players and S+ experts.  After a short tutorial and a couple of cutscenes, the game catapults your chosen Android into a campaign filled with relentless robots ready to wreck you. Using your unique primary and secondary weapons, as well as some helpful temporary powerups, you must destroy wave after wave of bots or duke it out with a fearsome Section Lord before proceeding to the next stage. Five hits will knock your character down, but you can press the buttons repeatedly to get back up and continue the fight, no problem! But don't party just yet -- Assault Android Cactus also features an interesting gimmick in the form of the Battery Meter. Instead of relying on a limited number of Lives, the Game Over screen gleefully waits for your Android's power to completely drain during battle, so be on the lookout for occasional Battery drops from enemies to keep yourself afloat. This feature adds to the intensity of the game, as you're encouraged to balance between being careful and getting aggressive.  If you wanna take a break from AAC's Campaign, there are indeed other modes to try out: Boss Rush, the Daily Drive, and the endless Infinity Drive. There are also fun unlockables ('funlockables'?), such as other playable Androids, and with enough hard-earned in-game credits, you can purchase character art and bios, story info, and the excellent EX Mode features. The EX Modes alter the game in cool ways, such as placing the gameplay in First Person view, changing the graphics (can you handle Psychedelic?), or even allowing helpful A.I.-controlled Androids to assist you for faux co-op play.   Speaking of co-op, while up to four players can have at it, I should mention that it is local only, as Witch Beam did not have the means to work in online multiplayer. AAC was originally to be only single-player, but they were able to change that at least. I sincerely hope the lack of online co-op doesn't deter you from trying out this game, and that perhaps the unlockable A.I. mode will suffice.  Again, if you're looking for simply 'a damn videogame', and don't mind local co-op, I highly and wholeheartedly recommend Assault Android Cactus. A lot of love was put into this game, and it definitely shows. Pick up an' play it!

This game kicks ♥♥♥. When playing, 12 hours can go by in what seems like 12 minutes. It has happened to us a few times. Don't expect to run through the game. It gets hard as hell in the later stages, to the point of ridiculousness. Assault Android Cactus is a rare example of superior game design.

A rather hectic yet fun top-down shooter with a bunch of different playable characters whose attacks are drastically different from each other gameplay-wise. The extra options you can unlock by playing are pretty cool as well. First-person mode with the ultimate lens flare effect is just nuts.  Starch > All

This game is just a ton of fun to play!The 9 different androids all play pretty differently and make it a blast to replay levels and try out different strategies. Plus they're all really cute and full of personality! The level design is great and is constantly changing things up or throwing new surprises at you. All of them are different and have really cool visual theming too, since each one is a different section of the ship the game takes place on, like hydroponics or freight zones. The music is some awesome EDM and it really gets you pumped to blow up robots, and keeps you going when you lose and retry.  I also really like the battery mechanic, where your battery constantly drains and you have to kill enemies to get more recharges before it drains down and you die. It fits so well into the core loop of shooting and dodging enemies and their bullets, and succeeds in making a bullet hell type of game that is really freindly while still giving a great level of challenge. It also makes the action, which is already fast-paced and relentless as hell, even more tense when you're on the verge of running out and are fighting extra hard to find that one enemy holding the recharge.  Also the boss battles are great and it has a whole bunch of neat extra modes and mutators. And local co-op multiplayer!! My girlfriend and I played through a bunch together and its a really fun way to play since you share a battery meter and have to watch out for each other.  Overall this game is a ton of fun and extremely worth the money. It is a phenomenally smooth and exciting fast action game and bursting with heart and personality. Go play it!!!

I didnt expect much when I picked this game up at a really cheap price. From what I saw in screenshots and videos, the presentation didnt appeal to me at all, the story seemed really uninteresting, and the aestethic of it all simply didnt mesh well with me. All of those things remain true even after I have beaten the game. However, that in no way should be an excuse to miss out on this, because what I didnt expect to find here was a videogame. And when I say videogame, I mean it in the rawest and most primitive sense possible that the term implies. This is the kind of game that leaves your hands sweating and your eyes glued to the screen in the hopes that you dont miss a single moment of action. Assault Android Cactus is a twin stick shooter, where the goal is to kill every enemy in each stage of the game. Thats it. Thats all you do here, the 'story' it presents is just an excuse to give some sort of context for the player to get back into the action, and besides shooting enemies, there really isnt much else for you to do here. And thats why this game is so great. It has no pretenses about what it is, and it uses its genre to full effect to give you one of the best arcade experiences in the last few years. Every stage is a frenetic chase to the end goal, with the screen filling with impossible levels of enemies and bullets while you do your best to avoid it all and stay alive for as long as you can, and every arena introduces a unique layout to shake things up, from floors disappearing when you step on them, to laser beams moving across the screen at certain intervals and making you run for cover just in time. The game also introduces a brilliant game mechanic where your character has a battery that depletes as time goes by and that can only be charged back by killing a certain number of enemies. This means you can never play it safe and stick to a corner waiting for enemies to come at you, as you will have to chase them at numerous times during the game just to get that recharge before you run out and fail the stage. This is what makes the game unique among other similar titles, as it provides alot of entertaining stressful moments where you are running against time as you throw yourself at every enemy just to get a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ recharge. The game has a huge list of characters to pick from, each with their own unique weapons and skills, so the game never gets stale, and gives ample room for experimentation and player preference. It also comes with bosses, and they all significantly ramp the difficulty up with creative attack patterns and alternate forms, the Final Boss being one of the highlights of the game. Soundtrack is amazing and perfect for this game, with one of the best Game Over tracks I have heard in a long time, that alone is worth losing a stage on purpose. So yeah, if you truly like engaging videogames that actually demand the player's effort and attention, then please give this a chance, it truly deserves more love than it gets right now.  And who knows, you might actually like the characters and story more than I do
A great game:

If this had come out in the 16 bit days, it'd have been an instant classic.  Major props to this dev team for Assault Android Cactus. Fond memories of greats like Contra while playing. The levels are chaotic and varied, many of them with their own spin, the bosses are huge and have numerous phases and often fill the screen with bullet hell style craziness.  Took me about 2 hours to beat it, now I have the extras and side stuff to mess around with. Enjoyed every second of it, worth every penny. Do play it.

Please just get it. It's really darn fun.  +++Pros+++ ++ Intense non-stop breathstopping firefights ++Cute Characters ++Adorable Dialogue ++Crazy shifting level design that keeps you gasping ++Cool boss fights ++Good sound engineering ++ DAMN FUN  ---Cons--- --No Online Multiplayer (which would be awesome) --Some characters are noticably weaker --Too much fun. You will get carpal tunnel syndrome from spamming buttons.

Reasonably Decent Twin-Stick Shooter. Beep boop! Eat your batteries,son - or you'll lose! Have to keep the pace of combat reasonably fast and divert from the usual evasive patterning in this style of game in order to make sure you're picking up time extensions. Miss too many of them and it's game over.  Some of the EX mode adds a fun twist when unlocked (First Person Mode?) XD I'm certainly not pro (though I have a fair bit of experience) and I'm definitely finding a bit of difficulty with the couple last stages of the game. If you can catch the game for 10 bucks or so, I'd suggest picking it up if you enjoy time-crunched hoard survival shooters..
Assault Android Cactus is freaking sweet. Give it a go, yo!
Why are you still reading this?  Go on, buy the game!
Most fun shoot 'em up / bullet hell game I've ever played, but I haven't really played these genres that much, so....  .... PINEAPPLE !!!
Cool

A truly remarkable twin stick shooter.  There are so many options in the game, controls are so tight, disgn is so sharp I never get lost, really I can't say enough nice things. If you have ever given a tiny damn about twin stick shooters you will find plenty to love here.
Fun co-op twin stick shooter. Very fast paced, cheeky
This game is mostly just really fun!

(done 1 layer of 5 levels + 1 boss)  Pretty fun, 4 defualt characters (don't know how many more char there is) all with 1 main and the second a special cind that has cooldown on it. Bosses the main fun with its design and they are all uniqe but in pattern maybe not so much.  +Fun +EX mode (earn credits to unlock more fun stuff I wish for more!) +Music is pretty good-decent +levels and some is their own special stuff on them (like for instant some turn dark) + most guns feels powerfull (some you feel it when fully upgraded)  - when with many enemies its just luck cind of game (toss that coin!) less skill the more there are (from bullets everywhere and too crowded with enemies = no visability) - not much of uniqe abilites that drop (there is now a more speed, more attack, stun enemies for 5s?) - some old quality is left from the past what you can see in cutscenes (does not really effect main gameplay) - needs more cactus!  -/+ would want something out of the normal -/+ more uniqe abilites -/+ coop specialties?

Awesome twinstick (mouse is better xD) shooter. Hours of local co-op fun. A nice campaign mode that can be played single player, or with up to 4 players local co-op. Weapons are nice and the unlocking of extra characters make for a altogether fun experience. Two other game modes, that I've noticed. I'm still playing campaign. Fluid and visually appealing with plenty of colour, for even normal colour vision individuals, to have trouble with. There are 2 extra colour options, for those with colour vision difficulties. Top game. worth every penny. Track 15 in Jukebox....Awesome lol
Good game, second to last lvl was tougher than the last imo and the game was too short. Still fun overall tho.
shoot fast, fun fast

So cool. Much fun. Pay attention during the tutorial since the battery mechanic differs to your run-of-the-mill health bar. Challenging yet approachable, the higher onus on offense over defense makes this somehow relaxing as well as exciting.
Greate game to play with friends in local co-ops mode!
A great fun twin stick shooter arcade game, local coop is pretty solid as well.
Fantastic game. Fun gameplay with tight Controls, amazing soundtrack, and a nice variety of robots to play. Highly recommend this game!

I got it from humble bundle, so glad I got this game.  Why?     Awsome gameplay    Different android provide unique play style     Each boss fight is unique    Power up and battery system make this game easier for new player    S+ is so hard, but feel great if you finally got one    EX option are awsome ( Some how you can play in First Person )   Looking forward to any new game from this developer.
Awesome, epileptic game, polished and fun (especially in local coop)
if the trailer looks like fun, you'll probably enjoy the game

Very video-gamey videogame. Game itself is easy enough, but a real challenge to get S+ ranking on each stage. Gameplay is your standard twinstick fare, with a good variety of 'ships' that each offer a unique playstyle. Excellent sound design, music and graphics, varied level design and a bunch of different enemies, it's just fun to play. A little bit short but has an endless mode and again, going for S+ ranking will take some time and dedication. Wonderful title all around, would recommend.

This is an overall great game. If you want some mindless pixel smashing, this is the game for you. The one unfortuinate thing is, they opted for local coop only. This is a missed oppertunity, they should have added online support for coop. Dispite that, I still recommend the game.

This is such an exciting game.  You start playing with 1 out for 4 starter androids. fight in small areans that are changes over the time. Each android has 2 different weapons and all of then are quit different to play with, you can anytime change your android between the areans or at the end of it. You able to play solo or in coop until 4 players.  Inside the areans you will be able to get power ups and you need to collect batteries to stay a life. This can become very thrilling specially during the boss fights. But lucky overall the game is very fair with the battery drops and you mostly able to escape near death during a normal area. ;) The boss fights itself are all very good and fun to play.   During my first play season I lost myself in the game and get really excited from it and I start replaying areanes and boss fight over and over again just because I was so close to a better rating or the area was just crazy because of the amount of enemies in it or want to try the same boss fight with a different android.  The grafic and the style of the game is very colourful and depends on the zones with different themes, all with nice light effects. Depends on the themens and the situation the music is also all the the time changing to it. The soundtrack of the game is full of good electronic music and its easy to get catched in the music and fight like it.   There are many things to unlock in the game starting with galleries, sounds, music too new androids, mods or tweeks on the game like different views, mega weapons. xD   If you like arena or bullet hell shooters and highscore races then this game is a must buy for you.  Personally this is my favorite game of 2015 with the most fun and enjoyment, no other game what i played that year was so good as this one and could take me in its ban for so long.

This game is a very fast paced, challenging and just plain fun twin-stick arcade shooter. The cast is primarily androids, a majority of which are badass females and I think I even saw a non-binary character or two. That's the kinda stuff that makes me happy. Local co-op gets hectic, and in the greatest way.  I am seriously looking forward to what new, wild, and crazy projects Witch Beam puts out in the future.

This is a good game. Tight controls, vibrant visuals, a decent challenge, a variety of characters (each with different weapons), and fast paced gameplay.  The one downside of this game is that I thought it was a bit too short. I beat it in just over 4 hours. Still, if you're looking for a fun twin-stick shooter, give this a shot.
A decent Shoot-em-up game. I would recommend it if you like top-down shooters like Gatling Gear or bullet hell shooter.   Only problem is sometimes it is hard to identify bullets from power-ups.
If you have any interest at all in a twin stick shooter you should get this game.

The twin stick shooter genre has been around since the 1970s with Gun Fight, and a few years later with the more well known Robotron 2084. The reason I bring those games up is because the twin stick shooter genre is one of the oldest there is, and somehow a little indie developer named Witch Beam has made a title that is one of the best in it's class... now onto the game.  Assault Android Cactus is a hybrid of sorts.   It's mostly a twin stick shooter, but there's a bit of bullet hell in it's DNA. The first few levels are fairly easy, as you progress the game gets harder, as more enemies appear on screen AAC becomes more of a bullet hell, and you have to make smart use of the invincibility you receive when you switch weapons.  There's 8 playable characters, each 'Android' has a unique primary and secondary weapon, and a bit of personality. All 8 play pretty different, and i'm sure you'll find at least one or two that fit your playing style. Witch Beam actually put a story with voice acting and cutscenes, something you rarely see in this genre. It's not the best story ever told but it has a lot of charm and style, and is a nice bonus.  Only real complaint I have is the last boss. Maybe i'm just terrible, but the last boss seems far more difficult than the rest of the game, and to this day I can only seem to beat it with a particular character, and only that one. But maybe i'm just doing it wrong, i'm not sure. Other than that, the game is excellent, looks and plays beautifully and I can see me returning in the following months even though I've finished AAC and play some more of the endless mode.

AAC is this rare gem, where you expect just a regular twin stick shooter and you get blown away by how good it is.   - Simple(two weapons only) yet strategic enough(booster pickups/battery).  - Character diversity - every one plays differently, you'll fast have fvourite one and one who you hate.  - bMaps - although they are mainly arenas, they are alive, moving, rotatiing, vibrating, or having big lazer beams. - Music, that perfectly suits gameplay.  -Annoying enemies you soon learn to hate and scream loud about those damn toaster dogs.  - Hard enough boss fights.  - Leaderboard, hit combos, ranks for each stage and characters.  - Co-op. - Fun modes including FPS.   I wish every game I grab have at least half as many features. Grab this shooter and you'll enjoy it.

This game is exactly what I wanted for my twin-stick shooter craving. Simple controls, awesome music and aesthetics, bullet hell sections, and easy to recognize enemies. The weapon switching also being a dodge button is such a genius idea. I've only played as Cactus so far, but being able to play as the others will give it some nice replayability.  My hand has cramps after finally beating the fourth boss, which I think is a good thing.
A charming and thoroughly enjoyable twin stick shooter. Easy to learn but hard to master. A lot of replayability for those looking to climb the leaderboards and get best ranks in every level. S+
A great fun twin stick shooter arcade game, local coop is pretty solid as well.

One of the most fun games I've played this year. I like the naive, but cute story and characters. Like gameplay and visuals. And absolutely LOVE the soundtrack. It's very rare for me to buy one on steam, but this time it was a no brainer. And to think I almost missed this game... It's not really my genre to begin with, and when I first saw the name, I was like - seriously? What kind of a name is it? It's so silly... but never in my life would I have been so wrong if I skipped this game.  There were nice big games in 2015, including MGSV, Fallout 4, Witcher 3, many small masterpieces like BoI: Afterbirth and Renowned Explorers... but Assault Android Cactus is undoubtedly Game Of The Year for me. It just stole my heart.  And you know what? Thanks, Steam, now I have a chance to nominate this game for the “I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award”! It's still awesome, and I TOLD YOU SO! :P

Currently one of my favorite couch coop games.  Finished the campaign like 4 times with different groups of people, and even alone one time. The only thing i would like to criticize is the missing NG+ or another way to progress, after finishing the campaign.  AAC is actually the only game you can play together with you gamer-guys AND your candy-crush-players and everyone is having fun all through the campaign. Sharing energy and being carried by the better players is such an simple but ingenious feature. Love it.  Chasing for S-Ratings in each levels isn't really motivating, if you don't get rewarded in any way. But who cares, you get so many hours of fun.  Go get it!

Tired of playing the same shooters? Then, try Assault Android Cactus! Have been soo long trying to find a old schol Shoter, and I finaly founded. I have spend a great time playing it and is amazing.  Works very well with the steam Controller that is amazing. Really fun.   Is worthly the price and very fun. Recomended!

Bright and vivid, got this for some ebgames Christmas gift and i gave it a try. I was expecting a free game to be rather dull and meh, but im glade i got this one, i will be playing it with my partner on the couch come sometime soon and reckon ill be up for a few hours of fun.

A really weird shooter that does some things right and a few things badly, at least for a casual gamer like me.  Graphics are great, sound is a bit repeditive. Controls are okay although a bit fiddly. What I really dislike about the game is the game mechanic where it doesn't matter how often your android dies. What matters is picking up batteries, which forces you to attack like made without any strategy.   Again, this is from the point of view of a casual gamer, I'm sure better players have lots of strategies. But for a casual gamer this game doesn't offer much so I can't recommend it.

i have some mixed feelings about this game. the combat is indeed awesome, and the game is realy realy fun. but it's kind of hard. especially if you main a character (don't. you'll just ragequit like a motherf---er during boss-battles (or maybe not, if you main starch)).  the characters are realy unbalanced, and that needs to get fixed. the boss battles are so stupidly hard, and all characters aren't suited for them.  the battery mechanic is also a realy bad idea. a regular health system would be better, and also more suitable in some ways.  overall, it's realy a fun game. but the final boss... the f---ing final boss... i'm literally convinced that the f---ing final boss is impossible to beat, especially without the mega weapons (at least you can reach it's final stage with them (and then die with 2 things left to destroy)). seriously. that thing needs to get nerfed into the ground, ASAP.  also, this game desperately needs online multiplayer.  the overwhelmingly possitive rating is overrated. very positive, at most, is more suitable.

I seem like the minority here but my friends and i found this game to be very repetitive very quickly. I thought this was an adventure but instead it is just wave after wave of robots in an arena.  Its not a bad game, just not 'Overwhelmingly positive' as the reviews would have you believe.

Initial impression: Overrated.  Missing a prime feature of a twin-stick shooter - An overhead camera.  You can only see part of the level, which is an unessesary mechanism to increase difficulty.  Reminds a bit of Mazer for the 3DO (which any old-school gamers will take as meant).
